Data visualization

There should be some data visualization here.

library("tidyverse")
## -- Attaching packages --------------------------------------- tidyverse 1.3.1 --
## v ggplot2 3.3.5     v purrr   0.3.4
## v tibble  3.1.6     v dplyr   1.0.7
## v tidyr   1.1.4     v stringr 1.4.0
## v readr   2.1.0     v forcats 0.5.1
## -- Conflicts ------------------------------------------ tidyverse_conflicts() --
## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
## x dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
library("readr")
library("ggplot2")
test <- read_csv("test.csv")
## Rows: 5369 Columns: 5
## -- Column specification --------------------------------------------------------
## Delimiter: ","
## chr  (3): Vaccine, Gender, Age group
## dbl  (1): Number of infected
## date (1): Date
## 
## i Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
## i Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
test
## # A tibble: 5,369 x 5
##    Date       Vaccine Gender `Age group` `Number of infected`
##    <date>     <chr>   <chr>  <chr>                      <dbl>
##  1 2021-01-01 -       -      -                              0
##  2 2021-01-02 -       -      -                              0
##  3 2021-01-03 -       -      -                              0
##  4 2021-01-04 -       -      -                              0
##  5 2021-01-05 -       -      -                              0
##  6 2021-01-06 -       -      -                              0
##  7 2021-01-07 -       -      -                              0
##  8 2021-01-08 -       -      -                              0
##  9 2021-01-09 -       -      -                              0
## 10 2021-01-10 -       -      -                              0
## # ... with 5,359 more rows
test1 <- test$Date
test2 <- test$`Number of infected`
ggplot(data = test, aes(x = test1, y = test2)) + 
  geom_bar(stat = "identity",fill="purple") +
  labs(title = "Todal daily vaccinated",
           substitute = "2021",
           x = "Date", y = "Vaccinated infected (day)")
